data.description: Optional, defaults to false. Whether to include swap statuses in response
A list of currently active swap UUIDs
Only visible if include_status=true. Map of SwapStatus objects by UUID (see /komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/swaps/#swap-status)
Return only swaps that match the swap.my_coin = request.my_coin condition
Return only swaps that match the swap.other_coin = request.other_coin condition
Return only swaps that match the swap.started_at >= request.from_timestamp condition
Return only swaps that match the swap.started_at < request.to_timestamp condition
UUIDs of swaps that match the selected filters
my_coin that was set in the request; null if not provided
other_coin that was set in the request; null if not provided
from_timestamp that was set in the request; null if not provided
to_timestamp that was set in the request; null if not provided
Number of UUIDs that match the selected filters
Ticker of the coin to price orders for
Use "buy" to request liquidity to acquire the coin, or "sell" to offer the coin
Amount of `coin` that must be filled by the returned orders
Optional. Defaults to false. If true, exclude the node's own orders from the response
Map of `ticker` -> array of standard OrderDataV1 objects representing the best priced counterparties (see /komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/orders/#order-data-v1)
Present when `orderbook_ticker` remaps a coin. Each key is the canonical ticker and the value is a list of original tickers that appear in the response
Ticker of the coin to receive (the coin you are buying)
Ticker of the coin you are spending
Price in `rel` per one unit of `base` (supports decimal numbers, num-rational arrays, or fraction objects)
Amount of `base` to purchase; must satisfy each coin's `min_trading_vol` limits
Minimum amount of `base` that must remain if the order converts to maker mode
Restrict matches to specific pubkeys or order UUIDs (ignored after conversion to maker)
Controls maker/taker behaviour (`GoodTillCancelled`, `FillOrKill`, etc.)
Override the confirmation requirements for base or rel sides
Override whether notarization is required for base or rel sides
Defaults to true. Set false to skip persisting the short order history locally
Always "Buy" for this method
Tickers of the trade pair
Decimal string totals representing the matched trade size
Rational representation of the matched trade size
UUID of the buy request
Effective confirmation and notarization settings applied to this order
Echoes the match filters and order type used for this order
Present when coins are remapped via `orderbook_ticker`
Ticker of the coin you want to sell (maker side)
Ticker of the coin you want to receive
Desired amount of `rel` per 1 unit of `base` (supports decimal strings, num-rational arrays, or fraction objects)

Maximum amount of `base` you are willing to sell; required when `max` is false. Must satisfy each coin's `min_trading_vol` limits for both the base amount and the implied rel amount (`volume * price`)
Minimum `base` volume that must remain for the order to stay open; must be â‰¤ `volume` and satisfy `min_trading_vol` limits for both coins
If true, uses the entire available `base` balance (leaving 0.001 `base` in reserve for fees)
Defaults to true. Cancels any existing maker orders for the same pair before placing the new order
Override the required blockchain confirmations for the base or rel side
Override whether dPoW notarization is required for the base or rel side
Defaults to true. Set to false to skip persisting the short order history locally (the order status is still tracked while active)
Optional expiration timer for maker orders. When set, Komodo DeFi Framework automatically cancels the order after the specified number of minutes
Order object describing the maker order that was created
Tickers of the order's trade pair
Maker price in decimal and rational representations
Maximum base volume that can be filled from this order
Minimum base volume the order accepts
Creation and last update timestamps for the order
Map of currently matched swaps keyed by counterparty UUID; empty for newly created orders
UUIDs of swaps that were initiated from this order
UUID of the created maker order
Effective confirmation/notarization settings applied to the order
Present when coins are remapped via `orderbook_ticker`; null otherwise
